text: The Inclosure Act 1773 (13 Geo 3. c. 81) (also known as the Enclosure Act 1773) is an Act of the Parliament of Great Britain. The Act is still in force in the United Kingdom. It created a law that allowed landowners to enclose land and remove the right of commoners to use the land. This act was a big part of the agrarian revolution. ==Sources== Category:1773 Category:1770s in Great Britain Category:Acts of the Parliament of Great Britain
title: Inclosure Act 1773
